title: Are players really surprised by ADC dominance when people begged riot to nerf mages and assassins?
body:
I mean you can't have it both ways.

People begged Riot to nerf the competing class of carries all season as well as the only factors that kept ADC in check before, and they wonder why ADC feel like they're next to immortal and untouchable now?

Corki and Lucian are caster ADCs, they deal a mix of burst and DPS. Similarly, Ryze and Azir (moreso Ryze) are mages who do slightly longer combos and seem like DPS. Cassio is the only actual DPS mid.

There's a reason the role system works how it does and anyone who says "ADCs are mandatory" have no clue how the game works from a basic fucking level. Let's go over it:

Top Lane: Splitpushing, Brawling, Tanking, and playing a counter to this (anti-bruisers).
Jungle: The ability to self sustain, kill the jungle, and gank.
Mid Lane: Deal burst damage.
Bot Lane: Deal consistent DPS.
Support: Peel for the team.

Now let's go over who can do that role.

Top Lane: Bruisers and Tanks, but also Anti-Bruisers and Skirmishers.
Jungle: Assassins*, tanks, fighters (they suck).
Mid Lane: Assassins, Mages, some Caster Marksmen
Bot Lane: Caster Marksmen, Hypercarry Marksmen.
Support: Enchanter, Warden, some control mages.

I don't recall anyone asking to nerf the mage class. People got excited about mage update - hoping for some improved items and stuff; especially more/better magic pen options. Instead, items were cheapened and lost a ton of their stats. Like why don't you see deathcap regularly in pro scene now? Maybe because ap champs are about 200ap short of what they'd get last season from the same build, so they need to go weird item combos like lich bane, protobelt, and gunblade just to have enough extra damage amplifiers to match the burst they used to have. No one in their right mind asked for a mage nerf this season. On individual overpowered mages, sure, but not on the class. That would be akin to when vayne could 3-shot everything in preseason and people asked to nerf her - then claiming people asked for every adc to be nerfed.

People didn't ask for assassins to be nerfed because they were assassins; they asked for it because lethality was too strong and almost everyone (toplane bruisers, mid assassins, jungle assassins and carries, and adc's were all abusing it). Sure people might have said "nerf assassins" or "nerf talon", but what they were MOSTLY meaning was "nerf lethality".
